greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Exponential transform of binomial(n,3) = A000292(n-2).
comment: a(n) is the number of ways of placing n labeled balls into indistinguishable boxes, where in each filled box 3 balls are seen at the top.
a(n) is also the number of forests of labeled rooted trees of height at most 1, with n labels, where each root contains 3 labels.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..530 (terms 0..200 from Alois P. Heinz)
Index entries for sequences related to rooted trees
mathematica: Table[Sum[BellY[n, k, Binomial[Range[n], 3]], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 25}] (* _Vladimir Reshetnikov_, Nov 09 2016 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 10 2008
